message:
*Important Notice*

The Foreign Training Portal is now open again and new projects have been added to it. The students can now start applying to the projects.
Deadline for the application to the projects is- 18th February 2018 until 11:59pm (IST).
Link to the portal is- http://www.ircell.iitkgp.ac.in/ftp/portal/login/

Note- Under no circumstances will any application be accepted after 18th February 2018, 11:59 pm (IST).

International Relations Cell presents you with Inbound Blog Series wherein we will share experiences of several foreign students and faculty members during their stay in IIT Kharagpur. 

We thank Professor Laurent Roumeas from Université de Montpellier, France for giving us his time and wish him good luck for his ongoing research.
Here is the link to an interview with Professor Laurent Roumeas
https://wp.me/p7L0xP-8p

IR Cell is proud to announce the grand success of the Foreign Training Programme. Students have applied in large numbers for different projects. Your applications have been forwarded. The shortlisted students will soon be notified as soon as the process is complete. We are in the constant process of adding as many projects as possible.

It is our pleasure to inform you that new projects will be uploaded to the portal by the 12th of February. 

We recommend you to keep your CV's and SOP's ready and look out for projects of your interest on our portal. Here is the link to it:
http://www.ircell.iitkgp.ac.in/ftp/portal/login/

French Embassy in India and Institut Francais en Inde (IFI) is organizing the Future tour for the first time that brings together scientists, academics and companies to discuss future partnerships between India and France under the third edition of Bonjour India in five different cities from 29th January - 18th February 2018.

The last step of this Future Tour will be organized on 17th and 18th February in Ahmedabad on the topic: "Smart cities: urban planning, architecture, and design".
 
Draft program :
Day 1 17th Feb at CEPT :
9 am: Opening session
Two parallel sessions of 4 Round Tables each, one session on Saturday morning (9:30 to 12 am) and the second one on Saturday afternoon (2 to 5 pm). And a networking dinner on Saturday evening at NOVOTEL Ahmedabad.
 
Day 2 18th Feb at NIRMA University
On Sunday morning there will be some presentations of existing Indo French partnerships as well as a session dedicated to PPP.
Sunday afternoon: one to one meetings between students, alumni, universités, and companies. 
Kindly refer to the following links for details about the programme:
https://www.campusfrance.org/en/agenda/future-tours-india-2018

Around 6-8 people will be invited to each roundtable.

https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B0-WusIde2k4NS1KMnlMWUp6OXUyMVowTUQxeW1hV2daU3FJ

Institute is hosting an international conference on Network Science and Digital Earth from March 7 -9. Department of Computer Science is taking a lead role in organizing it. Students are encouraged to register and participate in the conference.
Kindly Visit the following link for all further details:
https://web.northeastern.edu/sds/ICNDE2018/

Caltech's Summer Undergraduate Research Fellowships (SURF) program introduces students to research under the guidance of seasoned research mentors at Caltech and JPL.

SURF is modeled on the grant-seeking process:

Students collaborate with a potential mentor to define and develop a project
Applicants write research proposals as part of the application process
Faculty review the proposals and recommend awards
Students carry out the work over a 10-week period during the summer
At the conclusion of the program, students submit a technical paper and give an oral presentation at one of several SURF Seminar Days, symposia modeled on a professional technical meeting.
Fellows receive a $6,275 award for the ten-week period. Award payments are distributed in equal installments in late June and late July. 
For all further details kindly refer to the following link:
https://www.sfp.caltech.edu/programs/surf

The Department of Science & Technology (DST), Govt. of India and Indo-U.S. Science & Technology Forum (IUSSTF) has jointly announced a new fellowship program for Women "Indo-U.S. Fellowship for Women in STEMM (WISTEMM)" (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics and Medicine).The program aims to provide opportunities to Indian Women Scientists, Engineers & Technologists to undertake international collaborative research in premier institutions in the U.S.A, to enhance their research capacities and capabilities.The deadline for submission of applications is 28 th February 2018. This is a great opportunity for Indian women students to gain ground in their respective research areas. IR cell encourages all eligible Kgp’ians to make use of the opportunity. For more info, refer to the following link: https://drive.google.com/file/d/16_bp-e8GQDAvODL7bvffbraVmeqAuXdC/view?usp=sharing

Nanyang Technological University, Singapore hosts The NTU-India Connect Research Internship Programme which is a university-wide short-term research programme that lasts for 2 to 6 months.Students of this programme will work under the supervision of NTU faculty, develop a strong research interest and expertise in a given research field, experience multicultural living, gain a network of friends and a better understanding of Singapore.
 
Eligible students may be given an allowance and are expected to fulfil a minimum of 2 months research attachment involving research project work at NTU. Student will also receive a certificate issued by NTU-India Connect office upon completion of the programme.

Please read the following important note before applying:​ 

Internship Period

NTU-India Connect Research Internship Programme 2018 will fall within the following periods:-

Batch 1 (3rd January 2018 to 1st June 2018)
Batch 2 (8th May 2018 to 13th July 2018)
Batch 3 (1st August 2018 to 31st December 2018)
​​For Batch 1 and 3, students are encouraged to stay for a minimum of 5 months.
For Batch 2, students are encouraged to stay for a minimum of 2 months.

Application Period
The opening and closing dates for NTU-India Connect Research Internship Programme 2018 is stated below.

Batch 1 (15th July 2017 to 31 August 2017)
Batch 2 (1st November 2017 to 31st December 2017)
Batch 3 (1st February 2018 to 31st March 2018)​

Eligibility Criteria
Open to Pre-final year graduates / undergraduates who have not studied in NTU previously.

​​Qualification ​Duration ​Eligible period ​
 B Tech / B.Sc. (Degree) 
​4 years Pre-final year - End of 3rd year​
​M Tech / M.Sc. (Master) ​2 years Pre-final year - End of 1st year​​
​M + B / M.Sc. + B.Sc. 
(Dual Degree)​ ​5 years ​Pre-final year - End of 4th year​​
Students must possess good academic track records. 
M​ust be a student pursuing his / her studies in an Indian University / Institute of higher learning upon the period of his / her internship with NTU. 
Students that meet the minimum requirement with scholarships, publication and internship experiences will be given preference.​​
For all further details about the application procedure and other details,kindly visit: http://global.ntu.edu.sg/GMP/ic/Pages/default.aspx

An important announcement by the board members has marked a new milestone for the IRCell by appointment of a new Dean to oversee all our activities. Prof. Baidurya Bhattacharya will lead us as the Dean of International Relations henceforth. We have come a long way since the inception of the cell and now we wish to thrive under the new leadership of Dean Baidurya Bhattacharya. It'll be our immense pleasure to work under his guidance and build the international relations of IIT KGP. We are assured that he'll help us touch new heights with his vision. A hearty welcome to him and a new beginning!
story: International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur is with Baidurya Bhattacharya.

IR Cell, IIT Kharagpur is exhilarated with student’s response for application of foreign internship at the Foreign Training Portal.

The students are kindly requested to take a note of the following points:-

1. The deadline of application for the first series of project has been extended to 31st of January, 6:00 P.M. (IST). No further extension will be done under any circumstances.

2. The students can apply with a CV specific to the project. The students have to register with one single CV, however, the student may upload a new CV specific to the project in the “apply now” tab. This new CV (if uploaded) will be shared with the concerned professor for application.

3. Both UG and PG students can apply for the projects on the portal. If a student is facing difficulties with any part of the application process, he/she may reach out to us at:-

 irc@iitkgp.ac.in 

4. The students are requested to keep checking our Facebook page and the portal for new projects to apply.

The link to the portal is:-

 http://www.ircell.iitkgp.ac.in/ftp/portal/login/

For any queries, please contact

Shubham Arora
9800364888

The IU School of Informatics, Computing, and Engineering at Indiana University, Bloomington provides a ten-week summer research program named IU-SROC (Summer Research Opportunities in Computing) . This is to attract high potential undergraduate students to do research in the fields of computer science, bioinformatics, human centered computing, computer vision, health informatics, security, cloud computing, Interactive Intelligent Systems, text mining and high performance computing.

Eligibility: Full-time undergraduate student in an accredited university anywhere in the world.
Period: 8-10 weeks during the summer months of May through July.

Application Deadline: February 16, 2018

Application Material:

1. CV, highlighting top academic and research performances 
2. An unofficial transcript from the college you are currently attending (an official transcript will be required once a participation offer has been accepted) 
3. At least one letter of recommendation from a faculty member

Fellowship : $5000 + housing and a meal plan for this ten-week program

Description :This full time research experience includes work in the lab with a faculty and PhD student mentor, weekly professional development colloquia series and a technical writing workshop. At the conclusion of the program, all students participate in the IU Summer STEM Scholars research poster session and closing ceremony. Participants will have to prepare both oral and written summaries of their research projects.

For completing the entire application process please visit: 

https://iu.co1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_01zb9jiggRqnIvH

This is to attract high potential undergraduate students to do research in the fields of computer science, bioinformatics, human centered computing, computer vision, health informatics, security, cloud computing, Interactive Intelligent Systems, text mining and high performance computing.

Eligibility: Full-time undergraduate student in an accredited university anywhere in the world.
Period: 8-10 weeks during the summer months of May through July.

Application Deadline: February 16, 2018

Application Material:

1. CV, highlighting top academic and research performances 
2. An unofficial transcript from the college you are currently attending (an official transcript will be required once a participation offer has been accepted) 
3. At least one letter of recommendation from a faculty member

Fellowship : $5000 + housing and a meal plan for this ten-week program

Description :This full time research experience includes work in the lab with a faculty and PhD student mentor, weekly professional development colloquia series and a technical writing workshop. At the conclusion of the program, all students participate in the IU Summer STEM Scholars research poster session and closing ceremony. Participants will have to prepare both oral and written summaries of their research projects.

For completing the entire application process please visit: 

https://iu.co1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_01zb9jiggRqnIvH

message:
International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur invites you all to the launch of Foreign Training Portal. Foreign Training Portal is a unique platform which will provide the students with the opportunity to directly apply for a project under foreign professors.
This will also streamline the process of applying for a foreign training in a University and reduce mass mailing by students.
Attend the launching to know more about how to apply for any project through our portal.
Time: 6:00 pm
Venue- V4, Vikramshila
Date- 22nd January, 2018

French Embassy in India and Institut Francais en Inde (IFI) is organizing the Future tour for the first time that brings together scientists, academics and companies to discuss future partnerships between India and France under the third edition of Bonjour India in five different cities from 29th January - 18th February 2018.
The objective of these Future Tours are:
- to bring about joint initiatives in training, research and innovation.
- to promote the French training offer and to meet the students.
The agenda of the meeting is also to explore possibilities of collaboration and to deliver recommendations for the first high level Indo-French Knowledge Summit which will transpire in New Delhi in mid-March 2018 in the presence of President of France and Prime Minister of India. 

This Summit will bring together academia and industry from both countries to create a road map for education, research cooperation and mobility for the next 5 years.

https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B0-WusIde2k4NS1KMnlMWUp6OXUyMVowTUQxeW1hV2daU3FJ

With immense progress in science and technology, the young generation has failed to witness the rich culture and heritage of India. There are many organisations and individuals who are working hard to make an attempt in preserving this rich culture of our motherland. Keeping the same in mind, an international convention will be organised by SPIC MACAY, IIT Kharagpur and The Bengal Chamber at the IIT Kharagpur campus from June 3 to June 9. Aimed mainly at promotion of Indian Classical music and culture among youth this programme will have participants from different countries apart from various parts of India.
Kindly refer to the given link for further information

http://www.financialexpress.com/india-news/spic-macay-iit-kharagpur-and-bengal-chamber-to-organise-international-convention/1013933/

This post is meant for all the students who are aspiring for graduate studies especially from Computer Science stream.
The million dollar question: What next?
Each one of us wonders about the prospects of future after completion of our course. While USA and Canada seems like the lucrative choices for graduate studies, it is still hard to decide if you want to invest that amount of money and effort. Now get your queries answered in an extremely interactive session by Prof. Sourabh Bagchi from Purdue University.
Get insights on the subject and decide the best for your future! 
Date: Jan 9, 2018
Venue: V 1
Time: 6 PM

It is our honor to introduce Prof. Baidurya Bhattacharya who will lead the Office of Alumni Affairs and International Relations in the capacity of Dean henceforth. We aspire to take IIT Kharagpur to great heights under your leadership. We are thankful for the continued support of Prof. Siddhartha Mukhopadhyay who was instrumental in the formation and growth of IR Cell. Your dedication, energy and smile will always be an inspiration. Our best wishes for the coming year to all!!

Do you have an idea that can revolutionize mobility? Do you have an idea that can compete with the Hyperloop? If yes, here is your chance to showcase your talents. The French Embassy in India is organizing Easy Ride, a 2-day hackathon on the theme of smart and sustainable mobility. Easy Ride is a prototype and design competition that brings together teams of creative and ingenious students to come with innovative solutions on the theme of Smart and Sustainable Mobility. 
All the interested students are supposed to contact Mrs. Alivia Nag(alivia.nag@adm.iitkgp.ernet.in), International Relations Executive of IIT Kharagpur at the Office of International Relations. 
Please refer to the following link for more details: https://www.veltechuniv.edu.in/easy-ride/

Self Recommendation Letter | NTU-India Connect Programme

Since, we have been getting several requests regarding the self recommendation letter for NTU-India Connect Programme, in view of public interest, we suggest a few guidelines for the same. Self recommendation letter should have the following details:
1.Name
2.Year and department
3.Your competencies, achievements and awards
4.Your CGPA    
5.Your interests and why do you want to join NTU India Connect
   Programme

Please refer to the following link for a sample self recommendation letter: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ORdvW9-rzIUJehNpT5EEGICVpyhVgnDTlIiNy1FAkAQ/edit?usp=sharing

IR Cell presents you with Global Leadership Series, a unique series of interviews, discussions and guest lectures about leadership at the global stage. Today, we have with us Ranbir (Ron) Singh Gupta, a distinguished alumnus of IIT Kharagpur from the batch of 1970, B.Arch. Ron Gupta is a top-notch architect in the US with his own company based in New York. Along with his wife, Chitra, Ron created the “Ranbir and Chitra Gupta School of Infrastructure Design and Management“ (RCGSIDM), first such school of its kind in the world. Here is a short discussion on his philosophy of giving back, objectives of the RCGSIDM School and some advice for the young entrepreneurs.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mrIYXsEM11Q

IR Cell presents you with Global Leadership Series, a unique series of interviews, discussions and guest lectures about leadership at the global stage. Today, we have with us Ranbir (Ron) Singh Gupta, a distinguished alumnus of IIT Kharagpur from the batch of 1970, B.Arch. Ron Gupta is a top-notch architect in the US with his own company based in New York. Along with his wife, Chitra, Ron created the “Ranbir and Chitra Gupta School of Infrastructure Design and Management“ (RCGSIDM), first such school of its kind in the world. Here is a short discussion on his philosophy of giving back, objectives of the RCGSIDM School and some advice for the young entrepreneurs.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mrIYXsEM11Q
#MoU_13
#MoU_13

S.T.E.A.M School - an interdisciplinary hands-on  education and problem-solving programme, based on United Nation's Sustainable  Development Goals is conducting a 10-day programme, an immersive  experience with a mix of project-based learning, field trials, mentoring  sessions and digital prototyping. Participants include students,  academicians, scientists, engineers, architects, doctors, environmentalists,  strategists and artists besides others in the creative economy.  This presents a unique opportunity for innovative and dynamic students to  interact with a different cohort of people involved in social purpose. IR Cell encourages every IIT Kharagpur student to participate in it. Follow this link to apply:  https://steam.makersasylum.com/school/
